result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diego Silva

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Diego Silva appeared by video.  Attorney Jason A Findling appeared by video for Diego Silva.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of global offer and requests additional time to review offer with client.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Diego Silva in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Diego Silva.  Attorney James C Griffin appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Calendar Call. Discussion placed on the record. Court VACATED, Stayed Bench Warrant.  Court ordered bail to be maintained at its current level. Case adjourned for Status hearing, branch 2.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for scheduling conference.  Defendant failing to appear. State requests a bench warrant to issue.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Diego Silva in court with Attorney Jason A Findling; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Diego Silva in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-21-2022 @2p
